last_posted.tweet: US markets wrap a solid week: S&P 500 +1.6%, Nasdaq +2.0%, Dow +1.0% (week ended Sep 12, 2025). Tech led with Tesla and Microsoft among top movers; AI names boosted breadth. Fed-cut bets persisted as inflation cooled and jobs data softened.
last_posted.summary:
What happened this week: major indexes closed higher, with the Nasdaq leading at about +2.0%, the S&P 500 around +1.6%, and the Dow near +1.0% for the week ending Sep 12, 2025. 

What moved markets: tech strength dominated, led by large-cap names such as Tesla and Microsoft; AI-related momentum supported breadth across indices. Sector leadership skewed toward Information Technology and related high-growth names. 

What it means going forward: investors priced in a potential Fed rate cut next week as inflation cooled and job data showed signs of softness, keeping the market's up/upbeat narrative intact amid earnings season.
